item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 25, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Bitwarden SDK relicensed from proprietary to GPLv3 (254 points | 75 comments)
2. Quantized Llama models with increased speed and a reduced memory footprint (305 points | 72 comments)
3. OpenFeature – a vendor-agnostic, community-driven API for feature flagging (38 points | 1 comment)
4. Launch HN: Skyvern (YC S23) – open-source AI agent for browser automations (252 points | 55 comments)
5. Show HN: Rust based AWS Lambda Logs Viewer (TUI) (15 points | 3 comments)
6. Florida Eases Licensing Requirements for Foreign Trained Doctors (5 points | discuss)
7. Why Safety Profiles Failed (105 points | 65 comments)
8. Vapi (YC W21) is hiring a founding infra engineer to handle scale ( | hide)
9. Security research on Private Cloud Compute (206 points | 58 comments)
10. Zigler: Zig NIFs in Elixir (159 points | 48 comments)
11. Never Missing the Train Again (196 points | 66 comments)
12. Show HN: 2048 turned 10 this year, I built an updated version to celebrate (505 points | 171 comments)
13. Brush – A new compatible Gaussian splatting engine (102 points | 27 comments)
14. Post World War II Food (178 points | 136 comments)
15. Rsbuild – A Better Vite? (20 points | 8 comments)
16. When Samsung meets MediaTek: the story of a small bug chain [pdf] (26 points | 2 comments)
17. Lingo: A Go micro language framework for building Domain Specific Languages (66 points | 19 comments)
18. ST Book, the Notebook Atari ST (26 points | 4 comments)
19. Show HN: TypeSchema – A JSON specification to describe data models (76 points | 32 comments)
20. Quit Social Media (2016) (59 points | 59 comments)
21. Species in Pieces (32 points | 4 comments)
22. The Lion of St. Mark's Square in Venice Is Chinese (119 points | 39 comments)
23. The Anvil Text Editor (96 points | 69 comments)
24. U.S. Consumer Watchdog Cautions Businesses on Surveillance of Workers (70 points | 12 comments)
25. TLA from First Principles (16 points | 3 comments)
26. Data viz project that maps all earthquakes by magnitude (57 points | 10 comments)
27. Boeing 787s must be reset every 51 days or 'misleading data' is shown (2020) (122 points | 119 comments)
28. Show HN: Pneumatic – free open-source workflow software (23 points | 5 comments)
29. Rider is now free for non-commercial use (679 points | 329 comments)
30. Riot Games: Peeking into Valorant's Netcode (2020) (139 points | 56 comments)
